text: Kakava is a Pre-Islamic Spring feast, hold every year in Edirne on 5-6 May. At this day, the Romani people in Turkey, celebrated it with Music, Dance, Food and Bonfire, where the young people jumped over. After Bonfire Night, they went to the near River Tunca, washing feet, hands and Face and take candles there, and send wishes. They believe Baba Fingo a Deity come out of the River and protect them == References == Category:May observances Category:Edirne Province Category:Turkish culture
title: Kakava
